page.title: 11Cheriton Fitz-Communications
page.content: Nearly every house has a{telephone,}some constantly in use - even to speak to next door. The{mail}is delivered by van from Crediton, generally before 8.30am. Houses on the post-war estates get no afternoon delivery, but the older houses do! Before 1980 the resident Postmaster and local people were employed for deliveries.1n 1905 the postman came in a pony & trap from Crediton and stayed until evening {The Post Office} is an important social centre. People meet there when drawing state benefits, including pensions, and to collect morning { {newspapers}(the postmistress also runs a shop, including health foods, but, on principle, no cigarettes & husband delivers newspapers and periodicals in the village ) Evening papers are delivered, traditionally by one family
